pull.title: doc: bump the template macOS version since 14 is now the minimum supported version
pull.body:
Motivated by https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33489#issuecomment-3361601497

The minimum version of MacOS for this repo is now 14 and above so it makes sense to update the issue template to reflect that.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->

The v30 has still support for 13+. see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33559#discussion_r2414194987`
Think it's still to early to change this if v30 has still full support for that version.

> The v30 has still support for 13+. see [https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33559#discussion_r2414194987`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33559#discussion_r2414194987%60) Think it's still to early to change this if v30 has still full support for that version.

I don't think this change will be part of v30, so it should still be good for review

> The v30 has still support for 13+. see [https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33559#discussion_r2414194987`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33559#discussion_r2414194987%60)
> Think it's still to early to change this if v30 has still full support for that version.

Note that this PR is against master, not 30.x

> > The v30 has still support for 13+. see [https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33559#discussion_r2414194987`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33559#discussion_r2414194987%60)
> > Think it's still to early to change this if v30 has still full support for that version.
> 
> Note that this PR is against master, not 30.x

I get it. but it's changing .github issue templates. Github uses master as a base for the templates right ? 
So V30 or not when it merges it will use this template as a base. Or is it set by hand by the maintainers ? 

(either way it's not a big deal because it's merely a suggestion and not a pull-down or something)

> I get it. but it's changing .github issue templates. Github uses master as a base for the templates right ?

Oh sorry I misunderstood, you're absolutely right. I think it's more likely for people to use v30 on something more modern though.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,7 +78,7 @@ body:
     id: os
     attributes:
       label: Operating system and version
-      placeholder: e.g. "MacOS Ventura 13.2" or "Ubuntu 22.04 LTS"
+      placeholder: e.g. "MacOS Sonoma 14.0" or "Ubuntu 22.04 LTS"
comments.body:
```suggestion
      placeholder: e.g. "MacOS  26.0" or "Ubuntu 26.04 LTS"
```

nit: Those are just placeholders, so the value doesn't really matter. Though, if updating them, it may be best to update them in such a way that they won't need to be touched again for the longest time.

I understand that Ubuntu 26.04 doesn't exist yet, but there will be a daily ISO starting next month, which seems good enough.
